Job Description:
Bill of Rights Institute (BRI)

Please note: This position does not offer sponsorship. Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.

The Bill of Rights Institute is a nonprofit organization based in Arlington, Virginia, dedicated to civics and history education. We are looking for an extraordinary Financial Analyst. The most essential attributes for this position are accuracy, attention to detail, and the desire to learn and grow in the position. This is an opportunity to join an important and growing organization.

The Financial Analyst contributes to BRI’s finance and accounting team by supporting monthly close, budgeting, forecasting, reporting, and variance analysis. This position reports to the Director of Finance.

Responsibilities:
- Support BRI’s business excellence and growth with regular FP&A activities including monthly close, forecasting, reporting, and variance analysis:
- Participate in regular stakeholder meetings, track forecast updates, and maintain financial dashboards and reports
- Support monthly close by reviewing and preparing revenue, payroll, and non-payroll backup and variance to budget and forecast
- Actively engage with stakeholders to understand finance and accounting needs across departments and work to proactively support them

Qualifications:
- At least two years of experience in corporate or nonprofit finance, FP&A, or accounting roles
- Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
- Self-starter; demonstrated initiative and ability in defining/undertaking work assignments with minimal supervision
- Understanding of generation and interpretation of income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements
- Customer-focused mindset with a passion for making processes more effective and efficient

Bonus Points:
- Experience or proficiency with Salesforce, Tableau, Sage, Concur, SharePoint, and Monday.com

Culture:
The Bill of Rights Institute has a unique organizational culture we value and support. Our culture is affirming and collegial. We are achievers. We enjoy working with each other; our interactions are positive, respectful, and filled with good humor. We reward excellence and achievement. We embrace all diversity in our work and our workforce.

Equal Opportunity Employer
